Name: Der lustige Michel
Description:
The players have to get from space 1 to space 45. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on a space with a red number, he gains 2 coins but on a black number he has to pay 1 coin into the cash box. On space 40 the player wins half the content of the cash box.

The first player to exactly reach space 45 wins the game and the content of the cash box. If a player rolls more than he need to reach space 45, he has lost and is out of the game.

Name: Wir halten fest!
Description:
The swiss army defends her county with the help of italian and french allies against german and austrian invaders. In a second scenario the swiss army allies with german and austrian troops against french and italian invaders. The swiss army (red) and the allies (green and violett) consist of one unit (meeple) each, while the invaders consist of five units (black meeples).

The swiss army may move up to three spaces in any direction per turn, whereas the allies and the invaders may only move one space. Enemy units are taken by jumping over them.

The Invaders win, if they get one unit to one of two possible destinations. The defenders win, if they manage to avert this.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Long Dead Walkers
Description:
"In the deepest depths of the desert, something evil stirs. The dry hot wind carries forth a disturbing sound of chittering teeth before you finally see them in the distance. Pale, sun-bleached and emaciated, they creak forward with malice.

The Long Dead Walkers have risen!"

This Kickstarter exclusive expansion adds 15 Long Dead Walkers in 3 unique bone-colored sculpts, 8 additional zombie spawn cards, and a rules leaflet to add a new variety of threat to your missions!

Given their extremely advanced stage of decomposition, Long Dead Walkers are immune to Ranged Actions. Destroying these things requires an up-close and personal touch, with Survivors getting close and attacking them using Melee weapons. They are still affected by game effects eliminating all Zombies in the Zone, though, like Dynamite, and it's always a great satisfaction to see the piles of bones flying around after a big boom.

Name: Steel Rain
Description:
Steel Rain is a free set of generic wargaming rules for sci-fi armor battles. Specifically written these for use with 1/285, 1/300, and 6mm miniatures (these terms are basically synonymous), such as GHQ’s excellent line of Micro Armor miniatures, Brigade Models’ line of Iron Cow miniatures, or Ground Zero Games’ Dirtside/Future Wars models.

These rules are basic, covering most aspects of warfare encountered in company-level engagements. Designed to support company to battalion/task force sized engagements.

Also includes a set of vehicle creation rules that are pretty straight forward.

Envisioned using on a terrain table, not a hex map. That’s why all values are given in centimeters instead of hexes. If you want to increase the scale, use inches; the values will still translate. Or, you can use a hex map and just translate all values into hexes. It’s flexible.

summary from publisher's website

Name: Absolute Zero
Description: The objective of the game is to combine positive and negative numbered cards to create a value of zero. Includes directions for 3 additional games that can be played.

Name: Absolute Zero Junior
Description: In this precursor to Absolute Zero, the objective is the same but numbers are smaller and ten frames are added for visual support.

Name: Ten Fish
Description: The objective of the game is to combine 2 or more cards to create a value of ten. This is a very important early math skill. Many additional games can be played with the cards.

Name: Hunch
Description: A guessing game with a side of math. Kids will have fun while improving their understanding of integers.

Name: Ruthless: Tall Tales
Description:
The award-winning pirate deck-building game returns with an expansion. Chests brimming with new ideas and fantastical pirate tropes. Discover new thematic content, new mechanics and stunning new artwork.

The Merfolk: This new suit adds a dual rank mechanic, new powers and unique artwork. The Merfolk are a very flexible addition to your raiding party.

The Kraken: An ancient threat from the deep emerges. Attacking the Kraken becomes the priority and those tentacles offer plentiful rewards.

The Notorious: Infamous figures offer their services for the right price. By adding strength and strong new powers these characters are formidable allies.

Chests & Quests: Treasures await for pirates that achieve one off goals during the game. Will you keep the points, use the one time extra powers or recruit one of the Notorious?

New Powers: Five new powers are featured in Tall Tales, opening up new strategies and combos for the most cunning pirates to exploit.

Solo Mode: Test you prowess on the high seas against the pirate Queen Ching Shih in the all-new solo mode.

—description from the publisher

Name: ESPN Trivia Night
Description:
Face off against your friends and family in this high-octane sports trivia game! Draft sports categories you know you can dominate, or risk playing outside your comfort zone to net the big score. If you dropped the ball on your last answer, recover points in the active Instant Replay challenges. Outscore the opposing team or meet them in Sudden Death to decide the winner!

Teams take turns answering questions related to a wide range of topics in the sports world. Questions are worth those sweet sweet victory points and the key to winning - but don't worry if you can't answer "How many 3-point shots did Kareem Abdul-Jabbar make during his 20 seasons in the NBA?", that's where the dexterity challenges come in!

Miss a question? It's time for redemption by shooting a three pointer, getting one past the goalie, or kicking a 30 yard field goal in token-based dexterity challenges right on the tabletop! Successful shots will mean points for your team, and whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

-description from publisher

Name: Disney Princess: See the Story
Description:
Look into the magical wishing well! You’ll see enchanting objects and memorable characters from your favorite Disney Princess stories. Race to find two pictures from the same story! Toss your token into the well and point out two pictures from the same Disney Princess story. If you’re right, collect one of the coins for your Disney Princess board! Be the first to collect 4 coins in a row to win!

• Includes all 12 Disney Princesses.
• Turn the spinning bucket to magically reveal pictures in the wishing well.
• Glittering picture coins include 60 animals, sidekicks, and objects from the Disney Princess films.
• Babysitter Approved: Easy to learn, easy to put away, and fun to play!

-description from publisher

Name: The Bank Job: Mint Tin Edition
Description:
Note:  The mint tin edition has less cards and is only for 2-4 players while the standard edition is for 2-6 players.



You and your cohorts of crime have just pulled off the most successful bank heist of the century, including the theft of one of the world's most valuable diamonds. You must lay low for a week and guard your take; there's no honor amongst thieves here, and everyone wants the most they can get. Plus, rumors are there's a snake in your midst that might be out to get the prize jewel for themselves, and a rat could be trying to foil the whole operation.Each player will be dealt a random crew card to tell you what your part in this band of thieves is. These are not hidden from other players, since teamwork is dreamwork, after all. Each person brings their own unique talent, or specialty, to the crew, usable throughout the game. You will also be given a random role card, possibly giving you a secret double agent part to play. These should not be shared and will affect how you can win the game. There are four regular crew member cards, one snake card, and one rat card. As with any squad, the more people you bring in, the likelier it is to have defectors.

The game is played over the course of seven rounds, or days. Every day will begin with players taking turns to choose their actions for the day by placing a token on the box next to the action of their choice. For morning actions, you will use the numbers on your crew cards to determine turn order. After that, turn order is based on the last round's actions going from top to bottom on the action card in the center of the table.

Your goal, as the thief you are, is to hoodwink your way through the week, exchanging loot with players and the score to end up with the best take for yourself. Don't get too greedy, though! If you end up with more than the score, your zealousness will be shown, and the crew will take you out. The prized diamond is also supposed to be shared, so any crew member holding it at the end will mark you for an early demise, as well. Additionally, the bank loaded a tracker into the loot that will get you caught and disqualified if you're holding it at the end.

—description from the publisher

Name: Catch a Dragon by the Tail
Description:
Catch a Dragon by the Tail is a super-simple free print and play game. It's press-your-luck dice game for two to four players with a "hatching dragons" fantasy theme.

At the start of your turn you roll four custom six-sided dice (or standard dice that you cross-reference with a table), then choose to gather identical dice or different dice. After you do, you can stop rolling and score or you can roll the dice you haven't collected.

Homogenous sets of dice score the best: two dice score four points, three score nine, four score 16. Consecutive dice score second-best, with a run of two scoring four, three scoring six, and four scoring eight. "Loner" dice score one point each.

If you choose to roll again, what you roll may make you end your turn and score nothing.
• If you're collecting identical dice and you don't get at least one result that matches what you're collecting, your turn ends and you score nothing.
• If you're collecting different dice and at least one result matches a die you already have, your turn ends and you score nothing.
...Otherwise, you may collect one or more valid dice and choose to stop and score or roll the un-collected dice yet again.

The game ends after four rounds. The highest score wins. Break ties with an additional round of play.

-description from designer

Name: Cestou necestou
Description:
NOTE: this edition contains both Near and Far and Amber Mines expansion.


Four wanderers search for the Last Ruin, a city that legends say contains an artifact that will grant the greatest desires of the heart. A lost love, redemption, acceptance, a family rejoined-- these are the fires that fuel the wanderers' journeys, but can they overcome their own greed and inner demons on the way?

In Near and Far, you and up to three friends explore many different maps in a search for the Last Ruin, recruiting adventurers, hunting for treasure, and competing to be the most storied traveler. You must collect food and equipment at town for long journeys to mysterious locales, making sure not to forget enough weapons to fight off bandits, living statues, and rusty robots! Sometimes in your travels you'll run into something unique and one of your friends will read what happens to you from a book of stories, giving you a choice of how to react, creating a new and memorable tale each time you play.

Near and Far is a sequel to Above and Below and includes a book of encounters. This time players read over ten game sessions to reach the end of the story. Each chapter is played on a completely new map with unique art and adventures.

Answer the call of the ruins and begin your journey.

Name: DKT: Stadt Graz Wirtschaft
Description:
DKT, "Das kaufämnnische Talent", is the Austrian equivalent of Monopoly.

This version is about the city of Graz.

Buy local businesses and be the player with the most money at end of game to win !

Name: Caravan of Sundust
Description:
Become the captain of the caravan corps, plan the route, return with trade items, and develop your base!

Items that can be developed are decided according to the combination of traded goods brought back. Pick and delivery goods can also strengthen your caravan and help you acquire additional abilities.

Name: Monopoly: Châteaux de la Loire
Description:
Monopoly Châteaux de Loire: the classic board game where the goal is to be the last player not to go bankrupt.

This edition lets the player buy some of the most famous Châteaux of the Loire Valley (Chamborg, Chevreuil, Amboise, Chenonceau, Saumur, Angers, Blois...) of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Families: Constructions: Châteaux of the Loire Valley (France)

Name: Thrive
Description:
Thrive is an educational board game about health. The aim of the game is to reach your own goals by good choices. The winner is the first person to have sufficient cash to pay for their fourth goal. Each player takes a goal pad and writes four goals, ranging from short to long term, in the spaces. Short term goals are worth $50,000 long term goals are worth $1,000,000. The first player to $1,000,000 wins the game.

The game board resembles a square monopoly-style board with players moving their tokens on the outer track. A player is chosen as the banker for issuing starting money, collecting fines, etc. Players keep track of their points and earns money as they go around the track. Whenever a goal is paid in full, the score peg returns to zero and the player works towards another goal.

Name: MosDingTo: Bloody War
Description:
MosDingTo: Bloody War is an easy party game for 3 to 5 players set in the midnight of your bedroom.

In MosDingTo: Bloody War, players will act as mosquito for several time and human once. In both acts, players try to gain blood from the opponent as much as you can. Human will protect the body part and hit the mosquito to save the blood. Mosquitoes try to obtain information and target the unprotected human body part to suck blood.

In more detail, human first selects body parts to protect and leave the cards in the table. Mosquitoes have to dodge the human's intercept, steal the card and share the hints to companion.

Both acts will then select the body part from their hand to attack. Human goes first and mosquitoes fight back if they escape from human's attack.

The game ended when every player acted as human once. Victory is achieved by gaining most bloods!


        Ability of mosquitoes may cause a tons of joy all over the war, let's have fun with blood!

Name: Augenmaß
Description:
Augenmaß is a stacking game that consists of cones and boards. Players take turns placing cones on an A4-sized surface. Optionally, and before placing a cone, they can try to place a board on the tops of three cones. A successfully placed board gets a reward of coins - the higher the level, the higher the reward. If a player fails to place the board because it's not stable enough, they have to pay a penalty.
The game continues until no more boards can be placed. The player with the most coins is the winner.

Name: Steampunk Rally: Complete Promo Pack 2020
Description:
A complete set of promo cards for Steampunk Rally and Steampunk Rally Fusion released with the Steampunk Rally Fusion Kickstarter. Contains all previously released promo cards For Steampunk Rally as well as four new inventors new.

Content:
Steampunk Rally: Rube Goldberg
Steampunk Rally: Dr. Braun
Steampunk Rally: Ignacy Lukasiewicz
Steampunk Rally: Zhuge Liang & Lady Huang
Steampunk Rally: Spoiler (two copies)
Steampunk Rally: Red Green
Steampunk Rally: Lizzie Magie
Steampunk Rally Fusion: Leonardo da Vinci
Steampunk Rally Fusion: Mária Telkes
Steampunk Rally Fusion: Sergei Korolev
Steampunk Rally Fusion: Spede Pasanen

Contains a total of ten standees and 16 cards as the four new inventors are split across two standard sized cards.

Name: Battle Dragon
Description:
Battle Dragon is a print & play, turn-based card game designed to utilize the complete Dragon Stone set. Each player takes a turn by discarding a card to roll dice and then playing a card to build their dragon. The first player who can command a dragon to attack wins the game. Each game includes 17 print-and-play cards and ten dice with five colors for one player. The game supports two or more players.

However, there is a ready to play version for two player set.

The print & play version is compatible with a full dice set of AKO Dice III which was funded on Kickstarter in Jan 2021.

—description from the designer

Name: Ladybugs Do Math
Description:
Ladybugs Do Math is a Mathematical Board Game.

In a garden full of ladybugs, use the spots on their backs to solve math equations. Add, subtract, multiply or divide the two numbers to form solutions to equations.

Two different games included. For up to six players, 6+.

LASERCUT COMPONENTS: 
• 54 ladybug math cards 
• 41 interlocking numbered “answer” tiles (1-81)
• 16 interlocking “pathway” tiles
• four “corner” tiles
• four lady bugs
• 60 flowers with points 1-3
• five bird cards
• two spiders
• pair of dice
• two equation “cheat” sheets.

OVERVIEW:
• Build garden pathways
• Spot answers to simple equations
• Move your ladybug to the answer
• Collect a flower
• Avoid the spider
• Win with the most flower points.

TWO MODES: 
• Using Cards: with equation answers up to 81
• Die Rolls: Simpler game with numbers up to 36.

FULL SETUP (WITH CARDS): 
1. Set the corner tiles aside briefly
2. Shuffle the interlocking pathway and answer tiles
3. Takes turns connecting tiles to build the board game configured into pathways through a garden 
4. Distribute and connect the corner tiles, generally at the end of pathways
5. Give each player their ladybug
6. Each player places their ladybug on a corner tile
7. Shuffle the ladybug math and bird cards together
8. Place the cards face down in a draw pile
9. Distribute the flowers on top of the numbered tiles (some will get two flowers)
10. Place the spiders on any two blank pathway tiles.
 
FULL GAME PLAY: 
The game is played in rounds with players taking turns being the “current” player. 
At the start of a round, the current player will flip over the next ladybugs card. If a bird appears, each player removes their highest scoring flower then flips another card. Starting with the current player and continuing clockwise, each player will:
• Determine which equations can be formed from the two numbers on the ladybugs
• See where the equation answers are on the board
• Call out the answer they will use
• Move their ladybug towards that answer, not exceeding five spaces
• Collect a (highest-valued) flower if their ladybug lands on their answer number  
• Optionally, move one spider forward to the next unoccupied location

At the end of the round, each spider is moved one space in the direction they are pointing. The next clockwise player becomes the current player.

ENDING THE GAME: 
The game is over when there are no more flowers on the pathways to collect. Players add up all the points on the flowers they collected. The player with the most points wins. If there is a tie, the youngest player wins.

The simpler game uses a pair of dice to form equations. Game play is similar to above.

-description from designer

Name: Banana Katana
Description:
Banana Katana is a fun party improv card game where players take it in turns to control a monster and the other players have to combine cards to create an invention which will defeat it!

First a monster card is drawn by the monster player, then the other players take it in turns to explain how they would defeat it with their invention!

There are 3 different invention cards that the players much combine one of each to create their invention:


     The base of the invention e.g car, sofa, washing machine etc.
     the power source of the invention e.g pulled by seagulls, steam powered etc.
     the weapons on the invention e.g laser beam, spear, overcharged leaf blower etc


Before each player shows their invention they must also draw a malfunction card which adds a random element to their invention for them to explain!

Once each player has explained their invention the monster decides who’s invention would be the most likely to defeat it!

Name: Lee at Gettysburg
Description:
The battle of Gettysburg is the most famous of America’s blood soaked 4 year long Civil War. Although the historical battle took place over 3 days, the game should take no more than an hour to complete.

Lee at Gettysburg is the first of a series of small introductory level Civil War board wargames that gradually build in complexity. They are intended to serve as an introduction for younger players while still providing a quick and fun little game for more experienced players.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Tamagotchi: Das Kartenspiel
Description: The game board has a round indicator (1-8) and a score indicator (-240 to + 240). Players each place a token at the center of the 4x17 score indicator. A token is placed on the round indicator. Each player receives five cards. Players then take turns playing cards from their hand and moving their tokens to the right (positive) or to the left (negative). After eight rounds, the game ends. The winner is the one whose scale value is furthest to the right.

Name: Royal Court
Description:
Royal Court is a two player game using a standard deck of poker cards with the jokers, two 6-sided dice, and 9 Favor tokens of some sort.  To set up the game, separate the face cards from the Jokers and ace through ten cards.  Then the face cards are shuffled and dealt into a 3 by 4 grid, that will make up the Royal Court, which the players will navigate using their respective player die.  The ace through ten cards are split into their four suits, and then each player takes one suit of each color for their draw deck.  After this, they shuffle their decks and draw a hand of five, and then determine where to place their Jokers.  They must place it one side of the Royal Court, next to two cards within the court, but both players are not allowed to place their’s on the same side. They finally place their player die on their Joker, with the one pip face up.  These two players take on the role of a jester who is attempting to win over the Royal court.  They will do this by playing quips on the Kings, charming the Queens to gain their favor, and utilize the Jacks of the trade to manipulate their opponents.

There are specific movement rules for each card in the Royal Court, and the Jokers. which you can simply move to either adjacent card.  Jokers are set by each player at the start, adjacent to two cards within the Royal Court, so moving from a Joker means you have two options.  From the Kings, the players can move to any adjacent card to that King, meaning it has a number of possibilities, depending on where that King lies. From a Queen, a player may move anywhere within that Queens row, which gives players three options. Moving from a Jack, players must remain in that Jack’s column.

Once a player has moved to a new card, they initiate a Jest, except when moving back to a Joker.  When a Jest takes place, each player must play a a card matching the color of the In addition to each face card having a different movement rule, they also have their own Winning Jest Scores, and Win Results. Unless the players happen to be on the same card, only the initiator (the one who moved onto the new card), may gain the Win Result for that Jest.  When moving to a King, the player who plays the highest car, wins. The initiator may gain one Quip Point for winning.  If a player moves to a Queen, the lowest card wins, and the initiator may gain a Favor Token for winning.  Finally, on a Jack, the initiating player decides whether high of low will win, before the players play their cards.  When the initiator wins on a Jack, they may take away a point of their choosing, either a Favor Token or Quip Point. If there are none to take, the initiating player gains a Favor Token instead.  The end game trigger is when a player reaches six quip points, which is indicated by them turning their die with the six pip face up. The players will then compare scores, and whoever has the most points, Quip points and Favor points, wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: De Ronde van Vlaanderen
Description:
De Ronde van Vlaanderen, The official Tour of Flanders game.

Experience the magic of the Tour of Flanders and the Omloop Het Nieuwsblad .

Brave wind and weather, conquer the cobbles and slopes, try to shake off your opponents at the right time and stay ahead of the pack. Dose your energy, although you will have to dig deep into your reserves every now and then for profit and eternal glory!

Whether you choose the basic game or the expert version, each game will be different and surprising due to varying weather trend!

– Translated description from back of the box

Name: Aös, Capitale du vice
Description:
Aös is a board game inviting players to live a cooperative & competitive narrative adventure through a system of dilemmas, alliances and betrayals.

Fantasy, cyberpunk and solarpunk influences create an unconventional atmosphere in which players can immerse themselves.

You will have the opportunity to wander through the city of Aös in groups of 4 to 10. The game can be long or short, you decide!

—description from the publisher

Aös est un jeu de plateau invitant les joueurs à vivre une aventure narrative en coopération & compétition à travers un système de dilemmes, d’alliances et de trahisons.

L’univers possède des influences cyber/solarpunk et fantaisie, le tout plongé dans une ambiance décalée.

Vous aurez l’occasion de vous perdre dans la ville d’Aös en groupe de 4 à 10 personnes à travers de longues parties pouvant être raccourcies selon vos envies.

—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Dixit: Obscurio's Library Promo Card
Description: A promo card originally distributed by Libellud for a Christmas Letter contest.

Name: City Streets
Description:
A modern take on a property management family game. Up 4 players will roll their way around the board purchasing Streets and building businesses to achieve the highest net worth. During a player's turn they will choose to build a business and or roll the dice to move along the street (game board). The first player to build their 4th large business the game end will be triggered. With a different approach to managing properties and adding value, City Streets brings fresh new gameplay to the classic family game.

As player building businesses the streets will come alive with the unique buildings that change the landscape as more are added to the board. With an average time of 60 mins City Streets can be enjoyed by the whole family.

Get in on your opportunity to build your street.

—description from the designer

Name: Glymmore
Description:
Glymmore is an 18 card game for 2-3 players. Each player has a field comprising cards that have different colours and numbers on each side. Each card's value depends on the colour and number at the top. On your turn you have three actions which you can use to rotate cards and change their value and colour.

Once everyone has had one turn, the top card is revealed, which has an event to change the game. Then, whoever has the most points from their field with a matching colour wins the card. Players have to plan their cards strategically to win more jewels each round.

When there are no more cards left, players group their cards based on their colour. Each player counts up their points. Players gain extra points based on the number of cards in each group and for having the same type of jewels in one group. Who ever has the most points at the end wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Cosmos: The Galaxy Building Card Game
Description:
Cosmos: The Galaxy Building Card Game is an engine-building / hand management card game for 2-4 players, ages 13+, lasting 15-45+ minutes (depending on player styles). Featuring beautiful space art. Players draw from a common deck and race to create enough celestial objects into their area of space to complete a common goal, which takes the form of a randomly selected Galaxy card. Once the goal is achieved by any player, the player with the most points wins.

Players start with 5 cards and draw 2 cards beginning each turn. Every card in the game is multiple use; play, resource payment or special discard ability. Cards are played from hand by discarding payment but each card a player controls will also generate a resource token during their turn which may be used for playing cards. The more a player controls the more powerful they become thus making it easier to play more cards.

This game is about choices and sacrifice. And with many circumstantial abilities and effects the replay value is very great. There is also a planned expansion in the works.

—description from the designer

Name: WitchPig: The Midderlands Card Game
Description:
Designed as a fictitious, card-based, gambling game in the roleplaying setting for The Midderlands.
—description from the publisher

WitchPig is a card game implementation of the eponymous "fictional" card game from the fantastical setting of The Midderlands.  The cards bear standard suit and number markings but also have graphic elements to support the WitchPig game.  The pack comes with several insert instruction cards detailing WitchPig game play.  The cards are intended as a standalone card game, but also can be used as a "prop" in any roleplaying game played in The Midderlands.  Too, the cards have been adapted for use in a roleplaying game - see WitchPig Deck of Many Things.
—User summary

Name: Superyum!
Description:
Intended for ages 3 and up, in this delicious game, players will travel through Breakfastland, Lunchland, Dinnerland, and Dessertland, down slides made of bacon and through towers of sushi to experience cuisines of various cultures in this flavorful race to delivery!

As a brand that stands for #EveryFlavorWelcome, this game features a wide variety of cuisines, sparking conversation about different cultures and helping customers travel through playing the game.

Be the first player to reach the winner space, and choose dinner to order for everyone. Delivery is just one tap away!

DoorDash's first ever board game.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus
Description:
Welcome in interplanetary reality show Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus! As an artifical being called Animatron your task is simple: survive in crazy doctor Morbid Bolíto’s labyrinth full of dangerous traps and savage monsters.

Goal of the game is to successfully solve the Quests you will face in the labyrinth and get the fame and popularity among the millions of fans of the Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus arena. To achieve this you can leverage the plenty of upgrades also occuring in the labyrinth: biological implants, huge arsenal of lethal weapons and crazy Voodoo rituals.

The first player with sufficient popularity will be freed from the labyrinth and will be proclamated as a human able to vote and obligated to pay the taxes. And everybody wants that!

Name: Don Q. und die unbekannte Yante
Description:
Don Q. und die unbekannte Yante is an abstract strategy game for two, played on an 8 x 8 grid. Each player owns six pieces at the beginning of the game. The goal is to either reach one of the two designated fields at the opponent's base line without the piece being eliminated in the next turn; or to eliminate all pieces of the opponent.
A piece always moves exactly three orthogonal steps, with turns being allowed. If a piece reaches an opponent's piece's field, it captures that piece. Players can re-introduce captured pieces of the opponent on certain fields on the grid, but these pieces are marked; if they are captured again by their original owner, they are out of the game.

Name: Gangsterburg
Description:
The city of Gangsterburg was always the home of myriads of criminals and outcasts. Newly elected City Council knows the final solution! General amnesty and privatization of all city enterprises brings challenges for all mafia mob bosses to exploit the prey.

As a head of one of the families your task is to get more influence than any others and take control of the whole Gangsterburg!

In this Monopoly-like game you can buy the degustation companies (pubs), financial advisories (casinos), public services (brothels) and centres of experience (illegal drugs) and corrupt the police, judges and politicians.

Name: Misty Waters: At the World's Edge
Description:
A historical fiction game set in the "age of sail." As the captain of a small sailing ship, you sail into uncharted waters where strange things happen from time to time.

- The game board shows a map of the archipelago with marked sea lanes, which players will use to move their ship between islands. At the top is a large weather panel, with a Beaufort scale, as the wind strongly affects ships and possible actions. Thanks to the mechanics of uncovering weather tiles, players have an accurate forecast for the next two days.

- In their turns, players can move their ships, fight with cannons or boarding, and perform a number of other actions, such as building facilities, buying or repairing ships, selling goods and valuables found on islands or at sea, and hiring captains, officers and sailors. Moving ships around the board is extremely simple, but good planning and the use of maximum speed can determine the outcome of the game, as sometimes, especially close to the finale, it is very important to get our ship in the right place at the right time.

- Immediately after landing on an island, the player discovers the exploration cards there, which describe adventures, encounters, events or objects. You can find both good things on them (such as pirate treasures) and not-so-good things (plagues, dark forces, strange creatures...). So it's better not to approach this task without having a full crew and with the right action cards in hand.

- Although the Misty Waters are unexplored, the archipelago is nevertheless full of native life forms. Some of them are humans... Players will face all threats, but also other players.

- There are two trading posts with taverns on the islands. Here you can make profitable deals, gamble (inviting other players too!), meet "interesting" people, arrange risky tasks or missions for which you will need cargo holds, passenger cabins or.... cannons.

Each player builds a deck of Action Cards, which in fact is a set of useful tools, such as weapons, additional sails, maps, tactics or experts that can help in difficult situations, significantly affecting the chances of victory. Since the number of Action Cards is limited - you need to choose them wisely, according to your preferred strategy.

- Since the game is designed for 1-4 players, and each player can command up to two ships (6 different types), spectacular sea battles are not uncommon on Misty Waters. (Especially when the Galleass of the conquistadors sails out of the harbor, fully loaded with gold and jewels, and everyone wants to get it.)

- In addition to the players' ships, there are quite a few "AI" tokens on the board, such as pirate and conquistador ships, sea monsters, cannon batteries, rafts, and trapped chests in the sea vortex. You can also come across unique units, such as the Flying Dutchman.

- To win the game you must become the governor of the Misty Waters. You can achieve this either by: winning an election, conquering a certain number of islands, acquiring the legendary Conquistador Treasure. Often the fate of the game is weighed until the last minute.

- Players can choose team play against other teams, solo play or solo mode.

Name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Twilight Codex Volume I: Ordinian
Description:
The Codex is a web-based publication that highlights rules updates and showcases new content for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition and its Prophecy of Kings expansion.

This volume includes:
3 alternative faction technologies
2 alternative basic technologies
5 alternative faction promissory notes
20 additional action cards
2 scenarios
Several rule updates

Name: Mes Premières Énigmes Animaux
Description:
Guess who is hiding behind the illustrated clues!
Three amusing illustratiins are shown to all the players. Water drops, a shell, antennae... it’s a snail!
A pasture, some wool, a shepherd...

Which child will be the first to guess that it’s a sheep?

Name: Minimize
Description:
A card game where players try to minimize the range of six cards in their hand by swapping from the draw piles in order to challenge that they have the lowest score and go through to the next round. Your score is your highest card minus your lowest card minus any pro points and plus any bonus rule points.

The MINIMIZE deck consists of 78 cards, with 13 different numbers, 13 different colours and 13 different shapes. The deck has been designed so that it avoids duplication of each number/colour/shape combination.

On your turn you draw from one of the three draw piles and then discard a card. Some cards trigger actions such as being forced to swap more cards. Duplicate numbers deduct bonus points from your score (a good thing) but duplicate colours and shapes add points (a bad thing). When you think you have the lowest score you can challenge (but each player can only challenge once per round), and the player with the lowest score goes through to the next round, with play continuing. The last player left each round is eliminated and the player with the lowest score in the final round is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Lots
Description:
Lots is an abstract shareholding game with an unusual method of valuation.

Players will build 5 “Lots” of objects collectively, taking shares in lots of their choice as the game progresses. Each lot’s ability to score is dependent on the objects in lots to the right of it, so players will have to be clever to maximize the value of their own lots, sometimes sharing the spoils with other players to win.

Lots is a game for 2-4 players and takes around 10-15 minutes to play, making it a perfect after-dinner or lunchtime game.

—description from the designer

Name: Eveden: Next level card game
Description: Eveden: Next level card game is a two player card game playing on 25 squares arranged in an five by five grid. You are the representative of champion from one of the six region. You earn victory point by defeating enemy card. Normally, you earn victory point equal to the defeated enemy card. You immediately win the game when you earn 10 victory points.

Name: Magnet-Auto-Spiel
Description: The objective of the game is to navigate a car through a nature track using a magnet underneath the game board. A driving pole is used to move the magnet underneath the board. The player that navigates the car to the end of the track with the least mistakes, i.e. knocking over obstacles, in the least amount of time wins.

Name: Betelgeuse: The Celestial Strategy Game
Description:
Betelgeuse is an abstract game with a space theme; the 397-space hexagonal board depicts Betelgeuse in the center and six other stars near the corners. Players have a supply of stars in their colors.

On a turn a player rolls two dice and places one star with each them; the number rolled determines how many spaces away the new star must be from a printed star (at the start of the game) or a player's own star (later on).

Getting three of one's own stars adjacent in a triangle destroys opposing stars in a certain radius and prevents further play there.

Each player also has a single black hole which can be placed to cause additional destruction, and there is a neutral comet piece which also destroys things; the comet is moved when a player rolls doubles.

There is an advanced game in which players form "solar systems" by encircling empty spaces or the printed stars.

Name: 22Mars
Description:
22Mars is a very loosely connected sequel to 21Moon and gameplay wise a more complex bigger brother to 18Svea.

100 years after 21Moon, the year is 2217 and the space race has moved from the Moon to Mars. Earth is suffering from climate crisis and over population. The players, space entrepreneurs, are building train tracks and colonies, creating a new bright future on the red planet while the risk for a revolt grows connected to how greedy the players becomes during the game.

22Mars is an dystopian 18xx game set on Mars with variable map based on four interconnected megahexes and building track between variable value colonies depending on how many colonists are there.

The story so far – deportation of convicts, mining and space tourism on Mars

The year is 2217. Due to climate changes, the habitable parts of Earth are now heavily overpopulated. As one of several drastic measures to handle the population density, convicts on Earth are sent to colonies on Mars to work alongside androids and robots to build infrastructure for an alternative place to live. Ground-breaking technical leaps thanks to new hyper effective power source found on the moon have paved the way for time and cost-effective space travel, which in turn has made it possible to establish colonies on Mars. A number of corporations are contracted by the governments on Earth to build infrastructure necessary for building and supporting colonies on Mars. The first phase of Mars project focus on deportation of convicts from Earth, mining activities and space tourism for the privileged.

Name: Yard Builder
Description:
A relaxing drawing game where you design and layout the best yard on a grid. Combo unique yard features like trampolines, fountains and swimming pools to add to your curb appeal.

For 1-99 players. Plays well over Skype or Zoom. Requires 3 20-sided dice. If you don't have d20's, there's a Yard Builder Dice Roller that you can load in any browser.

—description from the designer

Name: The GAMES 100 Game
Description:
The GAMES 100 Game is played on two boards, one for each phase of the game. Some spaces on the boards show snippets of photos from the Games 100 (in the same issue).

In phase one players move around the first board using chips numbered 1-3; playing a chip allows a player to move exactly that number of spaces. If a player lands on a space with a picture they claim it with a marker; other spaces have instructions which are followed. If a player cannot move they take one of the played chips.

When a player has occupied enough photo spaces phase two begins on the second board; the player ending phase one gets to transfer their markers to this board, which block the other players. The first player to reach the ending space wins.

Name: Arma
Description:
Arma is a chariot racing game where two players alternate “shooting” a wooden disc called a chariot around an oval racetrack. Each player attempts a lap and a half around the entire board without being knocked into the gutter. The first player to successfully complete five of these laps will win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World – Volume I
Description:
Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World places some of the most important battles in the ancient world at your fingertips.

Complete maps, descriptions and army compositions that can be used with any Ancient rules set.

The sands of time reveal the struggle of power and control for those who dare.

Includes extra rules for SCUTARII.

23 Battles featured: 
KADESH 1300 B.C. 
MARATHON 490 B.C. 
ASCULUM 279 A.D. 
CALLINICUM 531 A.D. 
BIBRACTE 58 B.C. 
MAGNESIA 190 B.C. 
TREBIA 218 B.C. 
PLATAEA 479 B.C. 
CUNUXA 401 B.C. 
ZAMA 202 B.C. 
ISSUS 333 B.C. 
HYDASPES 326 B.C. 
GRANICUS 334 B.C. 
CHAERONEA 338 B.C. 
ARGENTORATUM 357 A.D. 
CHALONS 451 A.D. 
NIHRIYA 1230 B.C. 
BABYLON 1225 B.C. 
AD DECIMUM 533 A.D. 
NEMEA 397 B.C. 
PHARSALUS 48 B.C. 
RAPHIA 217 B.C. 
PARAITAKANE 317/316 B.C.
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East
History: Wars of Alexander the Great
History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

Name: Ten-Twenty Grand
Description:
Players attempt to reach a score of either 10,000 or 20,000 through rolls of six dice. Players must roll a minimum score of 500 and roll at least a one or a five to start in order to continue scoring. Subsequent rolls may be taken, though a player risks their scores by doing so. With each successive roll, players must roll a one or a five in order to keep scoring points. Point values vary depending on what type of roll a player gets (three of a kind, small straight, etc.), except for rolling six fives or six ones.

In the case of rolling six fives, a player automatically reaches 10,000 points and becomes winner pro-tem. The remaining players each get one final turn in an attempt to beat that players’ score. In the event of rolling six ones, a player automatically receives 20,000 points, and gameplay follows the same as if a player rolls six fives. The player with the highest score exceeding 10,000 or 20,000 wins.

Name: Domaniacal
Description:
Domaniacal is a fast paced, 2-5 player strategy card game. Played with domino cards, players take turns removing cards from their hands and stealing from other players to create a stack of cards. Once the draw pile is out, the player with the largest stack wins!

—description from the designer

Name: School Year Diary: NTK class
Description:
A co-op, school-themed, competitive, puzzle game for 1-4 players.

You are a teacher, an energized person loving school and classroom. You have desires to direct your students torward the best outcome. Each student brings their unique personality to each classroom. Each unlocked event brings new challenges for all members of the class.

You are going to:

     Give out directives and all students will follow. They listen to you.
     Collect unique items by unlocking experiences of your students. They share with you.
     Collect medals when your students achieve the maximum score of a subject. You are rewarded.


In Co-op mode (Cooperative), all players win together after collecting all medal rows on board.
In Comp mode (Competitive), the 1 winner is determined by comparisons: have the most victory points (VP), have their turn earlier.

The games featured random starting deck for each unique replay. The puzzle combinations, the directives in teachers' hand, the events and experiences to be unfold in each play are totally different.

All students from the game add their personality to the progress of the game. Each student is unique, dependant to each other, you can play with any combinations you like.
Because of that, players can actually design and print out their own students, their experiences and add to the game. Notes: the cards's designs do not need to follow the same as the game.

The game mechanics revolve around basic geometric puzzle. Allow players to be flexible to enjoy learning the game earlier and mastering the game later.

—description from the designer

Name: Lonely Cairn
Description:
Lonely Cairn is a solitaire game about finding the Northwest Passage in the mid 1800s. Modelled and based upon the ill-fated Franklin Expedition, players will need to equip their expedition and carefully chose what to take with them into the arctic. They will then sail though a channel of icy locations, facing deadly encounters along the way. They must reach the exit by the end of 8 turns, or face being locked in the ice forever.

This is a print-and-play game, with two main decks of cards, some tokens and a series of location cards. All components (and some alternatives) are provided in the PNP files. Expect your first expedition to take around 30min, with follow up games lasting around 15-20min. There are a million ways to die in the Arctic, so carefully choose your supplies and read the ice well, and you just might secure the coveted prize of discovering the fabled Northwest Passage.

—description from the designer

Name: Illusions of Prestige
Description:
In the trick-taking game Illusions of Prestige, the magician players battle it out on stage with their best tricks, with the winner of a trick receiving points while losers gain support from apprentices and gather props to use for rule-breaking illusions.

The game lasts one or three hands as you prefer. At the start of a hand, shuffle the deck of 54 cards — the standard 52-card deck, plus high and low jokers — then deal 13 cards to each player. (With two players, each player draws two cards, keeps one of them, draws two more cards, keeps one, etc. until each player has 13 cards.)

The lead player of a hand plays a card, and everyone must follow suit if possible; if they can't, they can play any card. The highest card in the suit led wins the trick, and whoever played this card places it to the right of their player sheet.

Every other player looks at the props depicted on the card they played, marks off each prop on their player sheet, then places their card to the left of this sheet. A player sheet has a number of special powers (illusions) listed on it, with 3-5 props underneath each illusion. As soon as you've marked off all the props on an illusion, you can use it, whether now or in the future. What's more, each player who lost the trick takes an apprentice token and places it in their reserve, where they can have up to three tokens. You can add these tokens to cards played in future tricks to increase the value of your played card. Transform a 10 into a Jack, Queen, or King!

At the end of the hand, score points as follows:

• For each card used to win a trick, 5 points.
• For each completed illusion, 3-5 points based on the number of props.
• For each suit, whoever has the most cards of this suit to the left of their player sheet scores 2 points for each card; ties are friendly.

After you've played the proper number of hands, whoever has the highest score wins.

In the solo game of Illusions of Prestige, you deal two hands of 13 cards, look at them both, then keep one of them, shuffling the other one to represent your opponent. When you lead a trick, you flip cards from the opposing deck until you find one of the matching suit. When the opponent leads, you deal two cards and use the higher one. Cycle through discards as needed.

Name: Advanced Premier Soccer
Description:
Advanced Premier Soccer is a dice-driven simulation of English Premier League soccer based on actual league and player statistics and suitable for either solitaire or competitive play. Advanced Premier Soccer upgrades and expands the game system developed in the original Premier Soccer by including factors such as shot location, man marking, individual defensive ratings, professional fouls, and revised durability and fatigue rules for league play.

Players take on the role of the manager - choosing a tactical formation and playing style, selecting a lineup, determining marking priorities, making changes in personnel and/or tactics, and dealing with the issues of player discipline and fatigue. The basic unit of play is the possession - defined as a period of extended control in the opponent's half of the pitch that may result in a shot. A typical game features 30-40 possessions and takes about 40-45 minutes to complete.

All team and player ratings are based on actual statistics from the 2019-2020 EPL season. Team sets for 2020-2021 will be made available following the conclusion of the current season.

—description from the designer

Name: Saving Mansfield Park
Description:
The historic estate of Mansfield Park has fallen into ruin. Franny Bertram, a descendant of some of Jane Austen’s most beloved characters, has turned a few rooms into a bed and breakfast and is trying to restore more of it, but she needs your help to find small antiques she can sell to fund the project.

Search the rooms of the mansion to find the valuable items and collector edition books before a hotel developer makes it up the walkway and inside the house. If she does, she’ll take over the mortgage and tear the mansion down. Then Franny’s dream will be no more. There is a secret passage which could help in the search, but you have to find it first.

You get to make choices in how you conduct your search. The item tiles are scattered throughout the rooms face down, and their location changes each time you play. With a list of what you need, you can roll the dice to move throughout the mansion, picking up items when you find them. Each time you look at an item in a room, whether you collect it or not, you’ll draw an action card which may take you to a different place, and that may change your strategy for your next turn. The action card may help the hotel developer move forward to the front door, and that puts the pressure on you and the other players to complete the search before she makes it inside.

Since you also need to put together a set of collectible books, all of which are piled in the attic, it’s your choice when to go there instead of rolling the dice. And then there is the location to the secret passage. Each player has cards that offer clues, but you’ll need to know who has what to narrow down the possibilities. If you are the first to work out where it is, you’ll be able to move freely throughout the house, but you’ll have to decide if it’s worth it to spend your turn on the search for it, or if your time is better spent in other choices. Players who are familiar with Jane Austen’s books will recognize characters and situations, but no knowledge of them is required to play. It’s all about the search!

—description from the designer

Name: La Martinique au bout des doigts
Description:
La Martinique au bout des doigts is a game to test your knowledge of the island of Martinique.

A game for 2-3 teams of players who need to answer as many questions as possible for each card.

The categories covers gastronomy, heritage, music, literature, geography, economy, fauna, flora, sport...

It contains 200 cards, 3 pawns, an hourglass and a board

Name: Operation Perfection
Description:
Players use the included tweezers to pick up the different ailment parts. But in this edition, they place them into the holes on Cavity Sam the way they're shown on the Operation card. The timer counts down as players hurry to insert the parts correctly. If they're successful, they keep the card and add up the points at the end of the game. If the timer goes off, all of the pieces pop!

Contents: Game unit, 20 ailment pieces, 21 Operation cards, tweezers and instructions.

Name: República Bananera
Description:
Republica Bananera is a party game created using black Spanish humour.

In this party game the President of the Republica Bananera will pick a red card with a blank space and other players will then choose and play a punchline card to fill in the blank. If their card is chosen they become the new Presidents of the Republica Bananera. If you are chosen 7 times you will be able to raise as a dictator and win the game

Name: Der lustige 7ner
Description:
Each player gets a game card and rolls two dice each turn. The result is covered with a game token on the game card. If a result is already covered it is only covered a second time, if the result consists of two identical numbers (für instance 4 and 4). On the roll of a 7 one token is removed from every number on the card. If the whole 2nd row is covered, the player uses only 1 die for the rest of the game.

The first player to cover all numbers on his card, wins the game.

Name: Sea Monsters Battle
Description:
In this matchbox-sized game, players are sending sea monsters out to battle each other.

Each player draws a hand of three sea monster cards and rolls three dice. Then, they each select one card and one die to send into battle. Players receive a point if their die matches the value on the card.

If both or neither players match -- or if the "Man" sea monster card is chosen, then the player with the higher die value wins.

Name: Volley and Charge!
Description:
Volley and Charge!

These rules are 1 page long.

They are intended for a quick and simple horse and musket game set in the middle of the 18th Century, using 25-30mm model solders.

They are meant for use at conventions or when time is short.

They are cut-to-the-bone version of Steady Bayonets 1756.
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Elekt: Intrygi
Description:
An expansion for true fans of the game Elect. The title Intrigues completely change the rules, forcing them to adopt new strategies. We randomize the plot or choose it before starting the game. The rule introduced by it will last for the rest of the game and will work for all players. This could be, for example, introducing a hand limit or limiting the number of attribute tokens. The plot can also introduce a new card into the game - this is how Bleeding Heart works - a card in the court's stanza that provides 2 Privileges and changes the ending condition. The Intrigue expansion also features new Missions and Influence allowing you to spend resources in exchange for Titles - get ready to get them. If you have nothing to sacrifice, you will walk away empty-handed by your opponents.

The set includes 24 cards:

    6 Unit cards
    3 Influence cards
    3 Mission cards
    8 Intrigue cards
    2 Privilege cards
    1 Bleeding Heart card
    1 instruction sheet


—description from the publisher

Name: Elekt: Artefakty
Description:
Collect filthy artifacts that will save your honor or plunge your opponent. The new card type offers previously unavailable actions, such as avoiding zone abilities or playing cards during the skirmish phase. Use artifacts in a creative way by surprising your opponents.

Artifacts are the biggest expansion pack to the Elect game so far.
The set includes 30 cards:

     8 Unit cards
     18 Artifact cards
     3 Privilege cards
     instruction card


—description from the publisher

Name: Elekt: Minstrel
Description:
The expansion introduces a new Minstrel Basic Unit and 4 Melody sets (Melody cards are marked with a note in the upper left corner). The rules of the expansion pack come into play if one of the Basic Units in your game is the Minstrel. Then give each player a set of Melodies (the set contains 1 copy of each type of Melody).

—description from the publisher

Name: Bannum & Bellum
Description:
Sinopsis:
The world is in war. War brings conflict, and violence and greed bring profit. You are a mercenary leader, a general. You have no land nor flag, and tou crave fortune, be it power, wealth or knowledge. The Lords you work for have given you the resources to fight their battles. Be cunning and lead your troops to voctory. Win the war!

Description:
BELLUM is a card game where players take the role of a war General. They will choose their units and send them to the battle.

Each battle takes place in a Battleground, where the players will put their cards to work for 1 coin each. The cards have different units, and they can combine with each other in different ways, supported by their Commander. The players’ objective is to arrange their troops in the best possible way to maximize their score.

When the battle (round) is finished, the winner will claim the Battleground and this will count as a victory.

The player who first achieves the objective number of victories will be the winner.

Name: Skyline Express: Bags & Belongings
Description:
Skyline Express Bags & Belongings is a super easy to explain expansion, that adds a new layer of decision making to the game. Passengers' luggage needs to be properly stored. Pick the right type of luggage at the right time to gain points , additional actions and ticket tokens.

—description from the designer

Name: The Rat's Lair
Description:
The rat’s lair is the first adventure in a series of mini solitaire card games. Each adventure is a stand-alone game that requires you to collect various items to help you defeat the evil Lord Zadorf in the final adventure.

The rat’s lair is a tile placement game where you must venture into the foul smelling, rat infested sewers in search of five artefacts lost long ago in the great floods.

Explore the vast sewer network by connecting stepping stones and search for the five missing artefacts whilst avoiding the killer rats which infuriatingly block your path.

Find torches to help you progress through the pitch black tunnels, poisons to help you avoid the rats, and collect as many artefacts as you can before making your way back to the sewer entry point – easier said than done!

Just making it out of the sewers with your life could be seen as a success, but you are going to need at least one or two artefacts to help you in your quest against the evil Lord Zadorf. Three or four would be preferable and escaping with all five should be your ultimate goal, but may be a step too far!

—description from the designer

Name: Grid Blocked
Description:
Grid blocked is a fast paced 2 to 8 player game where players take turns rolling the dice and placing tiles to create different patterns. Players that get the best combo of shapes boost their points. Players interact with one another with their actions to get the most points each round. The first player to reach 100 points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Champagne Ardenne
Description: Discover or rediscover the region Champagne Ardenne, in North-east France, in 1800 questions in 6 categories by playing with this edition of the Trivial Pursuit.

Name: Feisty Dice
Description:
A Wagering Game for 3 to 6 mostly grown-up Adults.

The game consists of a number of rounds in which players draw tiles, play a dice game and then resolve the results to hopefully increase their money (called "shekels"  and represented by various coloured chips representing various denominations).

The tiles come in two colours and two levels. The beginning, or "Scout", level orange tiles represent which game of four - Read Your Mind; More or Less; None the Same; or Knock Knock is to be played in that round. The beginner blue tiles are "Escapade" tiles, which give the player special powers. The advanced (Sage) tiles introduce more game options and new Escapades.

Each player begins with a set amount of shekels, a player guide which shows each game and the particular rules for that game, and a blue tile. The remaining tiles are placed in the provided pouch. On one's turn, the player draws a tile and resolves the outcome - either play the indicated game (orange tile) or if a special power blue tile is drawn, decide on whether to keep or use that tile. The game continues until there are no more tiles to be drawn from the pouch.

The player with the most value in shekels is declared the winner.

Name: Champagne Ardenne: Toute la Champagne-Ardenne en 1000 questions
Description:
A simple trivia game about the region of Champagne-Ardenne in North-east France.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

     History,
     Culture & traditions,
     Science & nature,
     Geography & tourism,
     Sport & contemporary life

Name: Imperial Armour: Index – Forces of the Adeptus Astartes
Description:
This is the complete reference book for using Forge World's range of Adeptus Astartes models in apocalyptic games of Warhammer 40,000.  Within this book are over 70 updated unit datasheets for the heroic commanders of the Space Marine Chapters and the tanks, aircraft, artillery, and Dreadnoughts under their charges, as well as the Grey Knights, Inquisition, and the Sisters of Battle.

With some of the most devastating vehicles and venerable heroes know to the Imperium available as reinforcements for the Space Marines, Imperial Armour contains vital reinforcements for beleaguered Space marine commanders int he unending war against the foul hordes of the mutant, the traitor and the alien.

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder of Crows: "'Twas the night before Christmas" Promo Card
Description: Free promotional card for Murder of Crows card game. This card adds an additional "M" card for building your murder.

Name: Pays Basque: Tout le Pays Basque en 1000 questions
Description:
A simple trivia game about the Basque country region Pays Basque, in South-west France and North-west Spain.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

     History,
     Culture & traditions,
     Science & nature,
     Geography & tourism,
     Sport & contemporary life

Name: Fearless Franco
Description:
Franco is an aging stunt daredevil. He wants to jump 10 more years and retire on top. His close associates include his trusty mechanic, his unethical doctor, and his gold-digging girlfriend.  And there are also side-betting spectators.

Franco earns money and glory from completing jumps. The other players earn money from the cards they play. Every player has their own agenda. So the game can change from a co-op game to a screw-your-neighbor game in a second.

Each player has their own deck of cards and play cards during a turn. The cards might earn you money, or affect the next jump, or help/harm another player. Some cards are LD cards and laid down and then have benefits for every turn. The most important card is a players Hold card. It is placed face down and is a player's end-game strategy. Are you betting on Franco landing a great jump, or trying to profit from his fiery death.

Every few turns/seasons Franco will perform a jump. It could be a luck jump by rolling a die, or a skill (dexterity) jump by sliding his vehicle token up a ramp and onto a target. Bad jump landings result in damage to Franco's vehicle and injuries to himself. His mechanic will need money to repair Franco's vehicles, and his doctor will try to double bill for any hospital visits.

Each turn is a season of the year. So a game could last all 40 turns/seasons. However, the game could end abruptly if Franco dies or is forced into retirement because of excessive injuries. When the game ends, the player with the most money or glory wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Defenders of the Realm: The Hero's Calling
Description:
A character-building expansion for Defenders of the Realm/

The King’s call to arms brings forth the finest Heroes to defend the Realm against a Darkness that engulfs the land. In this expansion, players will construct unique Heroes by combining power abilities and traits to battle the tainting of the realm. New Heroes come forth to answer the call!

In The Hero's Calling players will construct new characters by combining new abilities from 3 different types. The combination of these new abilities create powerful new Heroes to defend the realm against the Darkness.

—description from the publisher

Name: Royal Show Hand
Description:
In Royal Show Hand, players are ministers of the king, struggling to become the most influence person in the king’s court. But be careful, your king is very sensitive. He will not allow others have more influence than him in his own court.

In the game, players will collect a card pattern like a poker game in front to them, while your king will also form a card pattern in front of him.

At the end of game, the player who has highest pattern rank but lower than king’s pattern rank will win the game. If all players’ pattern rank are higher than king’s pattern rank, the player who has lowest pattern rank will win the game.

This game's basic rule can be played by a standard playing card deck.

-description from designer

Name: Vocational Guidance for Androids
Description:
Ever since our human creators were removed from the planet, many utility androids have lost their purpose. It is the Vocational Guidance Councillor’s task to decommission these androids. To avoid this fate you, as a poor carpet sweeper, will have to scavenge through discarded programmes and assimilate their code in order to prove to the councillor that you are worthy to sweep the streets.

As an ageing, defunct android, devoid of purpose, you must change your programming in order to avoid decommissioning by the Vocational Guidance Councillor.

During your turn, you will allocate action points across four rows of actions that you can perform with the aim of clearing the clutter, collecting energy cubes and purchasing code upgrades.

Initially, each row has a single action, but as you obtain additional programme cards to improve your Android’s “engine”, the more actions can be performed.

The game plays over eight rounds.  Each round, a new programme card is revealed, clutter and energy is distributed across the three locations and the Vocational Guidance Councillor is moved.  Players then allocate their action cubes to clear the clutter and collect energy cubes in order to obtain new programme cards.

The programme cards contain a mixture of VP, common actions as unique actions.

The objective of the game is to have the most VP by the end of the last round.  In addition to VP shown on the programme cards, VP is also gained by storing clutter on the programme cards.

-description from designer

Name: Micro Dungeon
Description:
Micro Dungeon is a simple and fast-played Card based Solo Dungeon Crawler set in a fantasy world full of Monsters.

In Micro Dungeon the player controls a hero who has to find the way out of the dungeon.

On his way through the modular dungeon he has to face various monsters, find keys to open doors and collect equipment to level up his hero.

But be careful, no part of the dungeon is safe, as dangers lurk everywhere.

Can you find the exit or will the monsters tear you apart first?

-description from designer

Name: Escape Adventures Adventskalender: Der mystische Express
Description:
Escape Adventures as an advent calendar. Help save Christmas by solving puzzles. Solve one of 24 riddle every day until Christmas. Only the right solutions leads you to the door for the next day. Included are mysterious objects, digital extras and an hourglass.

Information and solutions can be found online along with a time tracker to find out where you stand in comparison to other puzzlers.
Families: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Frogs on a Lily Pad Game
Description:
Frogs on a Lily Pad provides hours of fun for kids while teaching them their numbers. Who can collect the most frogs? Get it, play it, Enjoy!

How to play:


     Spin the Spinner
     Pick a number card that matches your spin
     Collect Frogs


—description from the back of the box

Name: 5-Minute Dungeon: Big Box
Description:
5-­Minute Dungeon is a chaotic, co-­operative, real-­time card game in which players have only five minutes to escape the randomized dungeon. Communication and teamwork are critical to survival because there's no time to form a carefully considered plan — and no predicting what dangers lie ahead.

In more detail, players assume the role of one of ten heroes, each with special cards and abilities. Once the five-minute timer starts, the race is on to defeat all the monsters inside the dungeon. In order to defeat a monster, players must match symbols from their hand with ones on the monster's card. At the end of each dungeon is a powerful dungeon boss — and after the first boss is defeated, the campaign continues to the second boss. Each boss, and each randomized dungeon, gets harder until players reach the fifth and final boss.

Also included, Curses! Foiled Again! is an expansion for 5-Minute Dungeon that brings new challenges and abilities to the party in their quest to defeat the Dungeon Master. The expansion adds Boss Cards to the Dungeon, two new heroes (Druid and Shaman), and powerful Artifacts that can be activated once per dungeon to help the party. This expansion also adds support for up to 6 players.

Also included in the Big Box are several Kickstarter only exclusives all bundled together in a limited-edition Curses-themed 10.5" x 10.5" box!

This is a Kickstarter Edition. It includes the kickstarter booster:
- 2 New Bosses
- A Deck with 25 new cars [15 Doors + 10 Challenge Cards]

NOTE: It doesn't include the "Baby Barbarian Figurine (with blood in the sword)" like in the kickstarter base game.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: For Whom The Dice Rolls
Description:
For Whom The Dice rolls is a set of innovative tabletop wargame rules for Brigade and Divisional battles in the Spanish Civil War.

The basic unit for the game is the battalion, and battalion level tactics are the foundation of the game, within the structure of one or two brigades aside (although the system will cope with more and will function for multiple divisions) . 
The rules enable the early "column" period of the war to be played, as well as the more formal battles that arose as the war went on. 
Troops are differentiated by their training and political commitment, to simulate the wide variety of forces that took part.

Command and control is driven by a normal pack of playing cards but is not completely random. 
Players are dealt a hand of cards each turn based upon the effectiveness of their army's command structure and the willingness of the component parts to co-operate with each other.

The system enables coordinated actions to take place, but they need to be well planned and are subject to greater risk and place more strain upon the use of command resources.

The rules are intended for using with 15mm figures, based to popular game basing conventions, but will work equally well with smaller and larger sized figures.
 A full description of the mechanisms can be found on the "Wargaming For Grown Ups" blog.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carbon Control
Description:
A board game with an organic chemistry theme, not requiring any chemistry knowledge to play.

Playing is centered around collecting carbon atoms, which act as the currency of the game, collecting molecule cards from different functional groups, building molecules to secure the atoms and receiving test tubes that gives a player different advantages and abilities. The player first to collect six different test tubes is winner.

Carbon atoms can be exchanged for other types of atoms as well as regulating an e-level, which must be kept in certain limits. Every time a player passes the Start square on the board all atoms that are not built into molecules are lost.

In an advanced mode other players molecules can be attacked and destroyed.

-description from designer

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Ancient Vox Box Tactics Card
Description:
Promo found in White Dwarf issue 458 from November 2020.
Play this card when activating a fighter.
When this card is played, decide how many times the activating fighter will turn the crank (1 to 3 times). roll that many D6, add the results together and check the effect.

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Venerable Machine Spirit Stratagem Promo Card
Description: This promo card was included in the November 2020 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 4 other games. It is a "Tricks and Tactics" Stratagem card.
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Kampen om Karlskrona
Description:
Kampen om Karlskrona is a game about the Swedish city of Karlskrona. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and it´s history.

—user summary

Name: Ex nihilo
Description:
Ex nihilo is a highly tactical and quite novel stack-fighting game with an emergent checkmate-esque win condition. The novelty of this game lies in its central gimmick: Every move consists in moving a stack. In this sense it is a pure movement game. Yet, the game features both placement and captures.

Rules:
The game is for 2 players and is played with stackable pieces of two colors on a hexagonal arrangement of hexagons (a hexhex board). The board starts out empty. The game is over as soon as one player is unable to make a move. The other player is then the winner.

Movement – overview: 
Stacks move along straight open lines and grow when they move away from the center cell. This game is unusual in allowing movement of stacks containing 0 pieces. It is by growing these that pieces get onto the board in the first place.

Movement – details: 
On your turn, you must move a stack not topped by an enemy piece to an empty cell reachable through an unbroken line of empty cells. By convention, a single piece is considered a stack of size 1 and an empty cell is considered to contain a stack of size 0.

If, after you have moved a stack, it is farther away from the center cell than before it was moved (measured in number of steps), its size is increased by 1 per step further away from the center it now is. This is effected by adding pieces to the top of it from your hand.

You may move a proper part of a stack by splitting it.  That is, if a stack contains several pieces you can choose to only move the top n pieces, given that you do not change their order, for any number n less than the number of pieces in the stack.

You may also move a whole stack, but only on the condition that you move it farther away from the center cell. A consequence is that moving a whole stack always results in its size increasing. Together with the convention that empty cells contain stacks of size 0, this also has the consequence that you can effectively place a new stack on the board by moving a stack of size 0.

Note that nothing special happens to the cell you moved the 0-stack from – it still contains a 0-stack.

Capturing – overview: 
Flanked enemy stacks are captured by being taken hostage for a move. Capturing is obligatory: If a capturing move is available, a capturing move must be made.  The winner will be the player who manages to force their opponent to capture an immovable stack.

Capturing – details: 
If (and only if) the top piece of a stack is of your color, it is said to partake in flanking an enemy stack if (i) this enemy stack is exactly in the middle of a line of otherwise empty cells going from the flanking stack to another one of your stacks, and (ii) all three of these stacks are of the same size.

If, after you have moved a stack, it partakes in flanking one or more enemy stacks, you must immediately move one of these enemy stacks. Except for the obvious difference that you are moving an enemy stack, all normal rules apply to this move. For example: If the captured stack grows (if you move it farther away from the center cell, that is), it grows by the addition of pieces of your color, so situations where this hostage move must itself be a capturing move are possible. Such chaining of captures must continue until you capture a stack that is not in a position to continue the chain. Growing captured stacks is the only way to take ownership of them more permanently.

-description from designer

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Bolt and Medusa
Description:
Blackagar Boltagon, known as Black Bolt, is the king of the Inhumans, a strain of humans genetically engineered by the Kree Empire to be living weapons. With his voice, Black Bolt harness immense power. When he speaks, he can produce a shockwave able to level a whole city. Even a whisper from Black Bolt renders his enemies feeble and broken.
